summary: The Early Detection of Vision Impairments for Children Act of 2025 aims to improve children's vision and eye health. It amends the Public Health Service Act to provide grants and cooperative agreements to states, territories, and Tribal organizations to develop and implement statewide early detection and intervention programs. The bill outlines eligible activities, including vision screening, referral to eye care, data collection, and public awareness. It also mandates technical assistance and coordination among various federal agencies and organizations.  The act authorizes appropriations for these initiatives and for evaluation and reporting.
